intro: Lippia diversifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree or red root, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible but often have a strong, spicy flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Lippia diversifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
